channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: PNP forms 'care group' of psychologists amid growing fears of quarantine stress, burnout
item.author: Franco Luna
item.description: In a statement, Police Gen. Archie Gamboa, who serves as chief of the national police, said: “PNP personnel are not only vulnerable to contracting the disease but to stress and anxiety as well. This may eventually lead to a serious mental health condition.”

item.title: Government quota keeps 14 OFWs stranded in Amsterdam airport — labor group
item.description: "Philippine authorities refused to allow them to fly back to Manila on the pretext that 'it already reached its quota'... [President Rodrigo] Duterte’s task force officials have recently restricted the entry quota of returning OFWs to 1,000 to 1,500 per day depending on the availability of quarantine facilities," the group said in a statement.

item.title: Second tranche of SAP distribution starts — DILG
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: The government has started distributing the second tranche of aid to low-income households and workers affected by quarantine restrictions intended to contain the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Philippines logs 364 new COVID-19 cases as tally climbs to 26,781
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: At least eight million people have now been infected with COVID-19 wordwide since it emerged in China late in 2019, and more than 436,000 people have died.

item.title: IATF allows transit of lawyers of persons arrested for quarantine violations
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: The government's task force on the coronavirus pandemic has allowed the transit of lawyers representing persons who were arrested while the government is imposing the enhanced community quarantine.

item.title: Guevarra confident Duterte will wait for DOJ review of anti-terrorism bill
item.author: Kristine Joy Patag
item.description: Guevarra told reporters that he is confident that Duterte "will wait for and consider not only the comments of DOJ but also those of other government agencies whose comments were requested by the office of the executive secretary."

item.title: Rights group asks DOJ to recommend veto of anti-terror bill
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: In a letter addressed to DOJ Secretary Menardo Guevarra, Karapatan Secretary General Cristina Palabay said the controversial anti-terrorism bill “can potentially further constrict the democratic and civic spaces in the Philippines and can have immense impact on the rights and civil liberties of human rights defenders and citizens.”

item.title: Spanish expat involved in scuffle with cop banned from returning
item.author: Kristine Joy Patag
item.description: The Bureau of Immigration has perpetually banned the Spanish national involved in an altercation with a police officer at a gated Makati village from coming back to the Philippines.

item.title: Malacañang hopes COVID-19 cases won’t skyrocket to 40k after GCQ extension
item.description: "First of all, UP’s recommendation was followed since we did not shift to MGCQ. They gave a warning that if we continue to loosen restrictions, we may reach 40,000," he said.

item.title: Preliminary probe into Pimentel's quarantine breach reset anew
item.author: Kristine Joy Patag
item.description: The preliminary investigation into the complaint against Sen. Koko Pimentel for breaching quarantine protocols set on Thursday has again been pushed back to a still undetermined later date.
